display

Class Layout

  • java.lang.Object
    • display.Layout

  • public class Layout
extends java.lang.Object
    The Layout class contains static functions for styling JavaFX elements. An external CSS-File can also be applied to the main Scene for some extra fanciness.

    Generally, every visible screen element is given the standard Insets by calling defaultMargin(screenElement). The root BorderPane of the Scene is given a padding with rootPadding(rootElement).This ensures consistent spacings between all screen elements and the window.

    The CSS-File is saved externally in EvoSim/src/style.css

    • Field Summary

      private static float prefWidth
      Holds the default width (in px) of screen elements.
      private static float VGap
      Holds the default vertical gap size (in px) between GridPane elements.

    • Method Detail

      • button

        public static void button(javafx.scene.control.Button btn)
        Sets the CSS styling for the given Button and sets its preferred width to the preferred element width.

        NOTE: defaultInsets() are not being applied!

        Parameters:
        btn - is set to default width and styling

      • fixedButton

        public static void fixedButton(javafx.scene.control.Button btn)
        Sets the CSS styling for the given Button and sets its minimum width to the preferred element width.

        NOTE: defaultInsets() are not being applied!

        Parameters:
        btn - is set to default width and styling

      • tallwideButton

        public static void tallwideButton(javafx.scene.control.Button btn)
        Sets the CSS styling for the given Button and sets its width to the to double the preferred element width and it's height to 50px. The horizontal gap for GridPane elements is considered. Text size is also increased.

        NOTE: defaultInsets() are not being applied!

        Parameters:
        btn - is set to double width and extra height with button styling, font-size is increased

      • wideButton

        public static void wideButton(javafx.scene.control.Button btn)
        Sets the CSS styling for the given Button and sets its width to the to double the preferred element width. The horizontal gap for GridPane elements is considered.

        NOTE: defaultInsets() are not being applied!

        Parameters:
        btn - is set to double width with button styling

      • squareButton

        public static void squareButton(javafx.scene.control.Button btn)
        Sets the CSS styling for the given Button and sets its dimensions to 32px by 32px. The font-size is increased to only fit one character into the element. (Use-case e.g.: help button)

        NOTE: defaultInsets() are not being applied!

        Parameters:
        btn - is set a small square with button styling and increased font-size

      • TwoThirdsButton

        public static void TwoThirdsButton(javafx.scene.control.Button btn)
        Sets the CSS styling for the given Button and sets its width to the to 2/3 of the preferred element width. The horizontal gap for GridPane elements is considered.

        NOTE: defaultInsets() are not being applied!

        Parameters:
        btn - is set to 2/3 width with button styling

      • gridPane

        public static void gridPane(javafx.scene.layout.GridPane gp)
        Sets the default layout and spacings for GridPane instances.

        NOTE: defaultInsets() are applied!

        Parameters:
        gp - is set to the default layout

      • labelTitle

        public static void labelTitle(javafx.scene.control.Label lbl)
        Increases the font-size of the Label given to make a title.

        NOTE: defaultInsets() are applied!

        Parameters:
        lbl - is given a title-layout

      • getSkycolor

        public static javafx.scene.paint.Color getSkycolor()
        Gives the default background Color of a TestScreen
        Returns:
        Color of the sky when TestScreen is running

      • getSkycolorInactive

        public static javafx.scene.paint.Color getSkycolorInactive()
        Gives the default background Color of a TestScreen when it is inactive / Test is over.
        Returns:
        Color of the sky when TestScreen is not running

      • defaultMargin

        public static void defaultMargin(javafx.scene.Node node)
        Sets the default margins for every visible screen element.

        Generally, every visible screen element is given the standard Insets by calling this method. The root Node of the Scene is given a padding with rootPadding(rootElement). This ensures consistent spacings between all screen elements and the window.

        Parameters:
        node - is given the standard margins

      • rootPadding

        public static void rootPadding(javafx.scene.layout.BorderPane bp)
        Sets the padding for the root BorderPane of the Scene. If all other visible screen elements are given the defaultMargin() this will ensures consistent spacings between all screen elements and the window.
        Parameters:
        bp - root BorderPane of the main Scene

      • setCSS

        public static void setCSS(javafx.scene.Scene s)
        Gets the CSS style sheet for a scene.
        Parameters:
        s - is given a CSS style sheet

      • instrLabel

        public static void instrLabel(javafx.scene.control.Label l)
        This method sets a default layout for a Label

        NOTE: defaultInsets() are applied!

        Parameters:
        l - Label in
